title: 'I really want to die': Chinese farmers feel the brunt of deadly flooding
description: Torrential rains and deadly flooding have battered northeast China, forcing thousands to evacuate and devastating farms in the world’s biggest food-producing country.

title: 178 gay German soldiers apply for compensation over past discrimination
description: The German defense ministry said Tuesday that it has received 178 applications for compensation from gay soldiers who experienced discrimination in the military in the past.

title: In Mexico, accusations of ‘communism’ and ‘fascism’ mark school textbook debate
description: There are few places where the debate over school textbooks has gone so ballistic in such a short time as in Mexico, where opponents are hurling cries of “communist” and “fascist’ at each other.

title: There are 1.7 million Indigenous people in Brazil — almost double since 2010
description: Brazil has 1.7 million Indigenous people according to the last census, nearly double that of 2010, due to people's greater recognition of their roots and better survey methods.

title: Son of Spanish actors arrested in grisly killing on tourist island
description: YouTube chef Daniel Sancho Bronchalo confessed to killing and dismembering Colombian surgeon Edwin Arrieta Arteaga on tourist island Koh Phangan, Thailand police said.

title: Pope says Church open to everyone, including gay people, but has rules
description: Pope Francis said the Catholic Church is open to everyone, including LGBTQ people.

title: Eight Amazon rainforest countries begin first summit in 14 years
description: Presidents of the South American nations home to the Amazon rainforest are converging to chart a common course to protect the region and address organized crime.

title: Even frozen Antarctica is being walloped by climate extremes, scientists find
description: Even in Antarctica — one of the most remote and desolate places on Earth — scientists say they are finding shattered temperature records and an increase in the size and number of wacky weather events.

title: Sinéad O'Connor fans say goodbye at her funeral in Bray, Ireland
description: Thousands of mourners lined the streets of Irish singer Sinéad O'Connor's former home of Bray for her funeral.

title: Italian man crushed to death by falling wheels of parmesan-style cheese
description: Giacomo Chiapparini, the owner of a Grana Padano factory in Italy, has died after being crushed when thousands of his cheese wheels fell on him.

title: 100 arrested, 13 children rescued in global sex abuse probe launched after murder of FBI agents
description: Nearly 100 people in the United States and Australia have so far been arrested over child sex abuse allegations after the fatal shooting of two FBI agents led to the unraveling of a suspected international pedophile ring, officials announced Tuesday.

title: Mourners gather in Ireland to pay respects to Sinead O’Connor ahead of funeral
description: Fans are gathering in singer Sinead O’Connor’s former hometown in Ireland to say goodbye ahead of her funeral.

title: Spanish actor's son charged with murder in Thailand
description: Daniel Sancho Bronchalo, 29, son of actor Rodolfo Sancho who starred in El Ministerio del Tempo, has been charged in connection with the death and dismemberment of a 44-year-old Colombian cosmetic surgeon in Thailand.

title: 19 men in Australia charged with child sex abuse offenses after FBI investigation
description: Australian police have charged 19 men with child sex abuse offenses and rescued 13 children after intelligence from the FBI of an international online criminal network.

title: China's summer of extremes has farmers worried about crops the world needs
description: Extreme weather in China this summer has taken a toll on the size of harvests in the world’s biggest food-producing country.

title: Niger coup leaders refuse to let senior U.S. diplomat meet with nation’s president
description: A senior U.S. diplomat said coup leaders in Niger refused to allow her to meet Monday with the West African country’s democratically elected president, whom she described as under “virtual house arrest.”

title: South Korea begins evacuating thousands of global Scouts from its coast as a tropical storm nears
description: Buses began moving tens of thousands of Scouts to inland venues Tuesday ahead of a tropical storm, bringing an effective end to a World Scout Jamboree that had already struggled with heat, hygiene and land use controversies.

title: Deadly Russian missile strikes destroy hotel and apartments, Ukraine says
description: Russian missiles struck the eastern Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk twice on Monday night, destroying a popular hotel and apartments, killing at least seven people and wounding scores, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Russian missiles strike Ukraine's Pokrovsk twice
description: At least five civilians were killed and dozens more injured by Russian missile strikes on the Ukrainian town of Pokrovsk. NBC News' John Lederman reports.
